intro: Angolluma abayensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are typically harvested when fully mature. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine layer of white pubescence, giving them a distinctive appearance. Angolluma abayensis is adapted to thrive in cooler, high-altitude environments with well-drained soils.
